intro: Erigeron breviscapus, commonly known as the Chinese fleabane, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves and produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Erigeron breviscapus is often used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
